get_data module

Data:

FORMAT

Expected datetime format

KLINE_COLUMNS

Kline columns of dataframe

Functions:

download_and_save_klines(symbol, interval, ...)

Downloads klines of symbol from from_date to to_date, at interval interval.

select_data(symbol, interval, ...)

Selects klines of symbol from from_date to to_date, at interval interval.

select_klines_from_file(beginning_date, ...)

Selects klines from a csv file.
FORMAT = '%Y-%m-%d'[source]

Expected datetime format

KLINE_COLUMNS = ['Open time', 'Open', 'High', 'Low', 'Close', 'Volume', 'Close time', 'Quote asset volume', 'Number of trades', 'Taker buy base asset volume', 'Taker buy quote asset volume', 'Ignore'][source]

Kline columns of dataframe

download_and_save_klines(symbol, interval, beginning_date, ending_date)[source]

Downloads klines of symbol from from_date to to_date, at interval interval.

Parameters

  • symbol (str) – ticker to download eg BTCUSDT

  • interval (str) – interval of klines, eg 6h

  • beginning_date (datetime) – open time

  • ending_date (datetime) – close time

Returns

filename of csv file containing the klines

Return type

str

select_data(symbol, interval, beginning_date, ending_date)[source]

Selects klines of symbol from from_date to to_date, at interval interval. If the klines have already been downloaded, it fetches it in the csv file. Otherwise, it downloads the data from the Binance API.

Parameters

  • symbol (str) – ticker to download eg BTCUSDT

  • interval (str) – interval of klines, eg 6h

  • beginning_date (datetime) – open time

  • ending_date (datetime) – close time

Returns:

select_klines_from_file(beginning_date, ending_date, filename)[source]

Selects klines from a csv file. These klines open at beginning_date and close at ending_date.

Parameters

  • beginning_date (datetime) – open time

  • ending_date (datetime) – close time

  • filename (str) – filename of the csv file to open

Returns

dataframe containing klines

Return type

pd.DataFrame
